ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GPS Deduced ROTI Index, Standard Deviation of the Rate of Change of the Total Electron Content (TEC), World Maps and Movies, 15 min Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, metadata versioned up to SPASE 2.6.0, reviewed by LFB 20230727

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: The ROTI Index is the Standard Deviation of the Rate of Change of the Total Electron Content, TEC, during a 15 min Interval. The TEC Values are measured between a Global Positioning Satellite, GPS, and Ground Receiver Station.

InformationURL.Name: JPL Ionospheric and Atmospheric Remote Sensing Web Site

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time, since 0 A.D.
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time, Milliseconds since 0 A.D., NSSDC Standard Reference Time Value
Parameter.Caveats: Average Type: standard This parameter exhibits an increasing monotonic progression.

Parameter.Name: ROTI, Unmapped Image
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH

Parameter.Name: ROTI, Cylindrical Projection, Thumbnails
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function ALTERNATE_VIEW with the following input parameters: rotimed.

Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function ALTERNATE_VIEW with the following input parameters: rotimed.
